column2: TENNESSEE DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Tennessee

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column4: red; white

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter

column2: 3. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 4. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: No parking on pavement.

column2: 6. For proper parking, if stopping at a curb you should move to within _______ of the curb.
column4: 12 inches

column2: 7. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 8. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: right turns are not allowed.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 10. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column6: buckled up in the front seat.
column8: buckled up in the back seat.

column2: 11. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 12. It is illegal to park:
column4: on public roadways.
column6: within 50 feet of a railroad crossing.
column8: within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery when wet

column2: 14. A broken yellow line to the right of a solid yellow center line means:
column4: you are only allowed to make left turns in this area.
column8: you may pass other vehicles if no oncoming traffic is present.

column2: 15. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
column8: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.

column2: 16. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 17. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 18. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 19. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a cross road.

column2: 22. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: finish crossing the street.
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 23. At an intersection with traffic signals, if you are not in the proper lane to make a right or left turn you should:
column4: continue to the next intersection to make the desired turn.
column6: stop and wait until the way is clear before turning.
column8: signal the direction you want to go and wait for a gap.

column2: 24. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Law

column2: 25. An advisory letter is mailed to a licensee having ____ points on a driving record within twelve months.
26. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
column4: in your side mirrors.

column2: 27. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 28. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column6: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
column8: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.

column2: 29. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 30. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH slower than most.
column8: drive a few MPH faster than most.
